item.description:
Spring Cleaning at Fort Williams in Cape Elizabeth

On Saturday at 10:00 Robert and a bunch of trash bags will be trying to collect the remains of the winter storms for 1-2 hours. I've talked with the parks manager and gotten a trash drop off point. People seem to leave trash in places that already have trash so if we can get it clean now , it will stay cleaner and more enjoyable for longer. The more the merrier so I hope you can come along and help make it a nice place to be.

Things to be aware of:
- Cape Elizabeth is a hotbed for deer ticks, be careful in the underbrush.
- Poison ivy can be a problem, be careful in the underbrush.
- Robert has yet to see a needle at this park, however if we see one, we'll make a note of the the location, notify the appropriate people, and leave it there.

*Please bring work gloves and trash bags.

Location

Beach at ships cove near playground at Ft Williams


Everyone who RSVPs yes will get a e-mail from Robert on Friday. Feel free to contact Robert at colanton@gmail.com with questions.
item.name: Spring Cleaning - Fort Williams in Cape Elizabeth
